00031 // FS error codes:
00032 enum FatError {
00033     FatErrorFailure                 = FS_FAILURE,
00034     FatErrorSuccess                 = FS_SUCCESS,
00035     FatErrorOperationNotPossible    = FS_ERR_OPERATION_NOT_POSSIBLE,
00036     FatErrorUserIdError             = FS_ERR_USER_ID_ERROR,
00037 
00038     /* Arguments to critical_error_handler() */
00039     FatErrorBadFormat               = FS_ERR_BAD_FORMAT,
00040     FatErrorNoCard                  = FS_ERR_NO_MEDIA,
00041     FatErrorBadCard                 = FS_ERR_BAD_MEDIA,
00042     FatChangedCard                  = FS_ERR_MEDIA_CHANGED,
00043     FatErrorCardFailure             = FS_ERR_MEDIA_FAILURE,
00044     FatErrorIdError                 = FS_ERR_ID_ERROR,
00045     FatErrorEccError                = FS_ERR_ECC_ERROR,
00046 
00047     /* Filesystem Errno values */
00048     FatErrorNotExist                = FS_ERR_NOENT, /* File not found or path to file not found */
00049     FatErrorBadFileDescriptor       = FS_ERR_BADF,  /* Invalid file descriptor */
00050     FatErrorAccessDenied            = FS_ERR_ACCES, /* Attempt to open a read only file or a special (directory) */
00051     FatErrorFileAlreadyExist        = FS_ERR_EXIST, /* Exclusive access requested but file already exists. */
00052     FatErrorUnknown                 = FS_ERR_FAULT, /* Unknown error. */
00053     FatErrorIO                      = FS_ERR_IO,    /* I/O error. */
00054     FatErrorNegativeFilePointer     = FS_ERR_INVAL, /* Seek to negative file pointer attempted. */
00055     FatErrorTooManyFileOpen         = FS_ERR_MFILE, /* No file descriptors available (too many files open) */
00056     FatErrorNoSpace                 = FS_ERR_NOSPC, /* Write failed. Presumably because of no space */
00057     FatErrorShare                   = FS_ERR_SHARE, /* Open failed do to sharing */
00058     FatErrorNoDisk                  = FS_ERR_DEVICE /* No Valid Disk Present */
00059 };
00060 
00061 /* File open modes */
00062 enum FatOpenMode {
00063     FatReadOnlyMode     = FS_IREAD,
00064     FatReadAndWriteMode = FS_IREAD | FS_IWRITE
00065 };
00066 
00067 /* File access flags */
00068 #define FatAccessFlagRdOnly         FS_RDONLY
00069 #define FatAccessFlagWrOnly         FS_WRONLY
00070 #define FatAccessFlagRdWr           FS_RDWR
00071 #define FatAccessFlagAppend         FS_APPEND
00072 #define FatAccessFlagCreate         FS_CREAT
00073 #define FatAccessFlagTrunc          FS_TRUNC
00074 #define FatAccessFlagExcl           FS_EXCL
00075 #define FatAccessFlagText           FS_TEXT
00076 #define FatAccessFlagBinary         FS_BINARY
00077 #define FatAccessFlagNoShareAny     FS_NOSHAREANY
00078 #define FatAccessFlagNoShareWrite   FS_NOSHAREWRITE
00079

00081 #define FatSeekBegin                FS_SEEK_SET
00082 #define FatSeekCurrent              FS_SEEK_CUR
00083 #define FatSeekEnd                  FS_SEEK_END

00085 typedef DATESTR FatTimeRecord;
00086 
00087 /* File info type */
00088 struct FatFileInfo {
00089     UINT32          st_mode;        /* (see S_xxxx below) */
00090     UINT32          st_size;        /* file size, in bytes */
00091     INT32           st_blksize;     /* optimal block size for I/O (cluster size) */
00092     INT32           st_blocks;      /* blocks allocated for file */
00093     FatTimeRecord   st_atime;       /* last access (all times are the same) */
00094     FatTimeRecord   st_mtime;       /* last modification */
00095     FatTimeRecord   st_ctime;       /* last file status change */
00096     INT16           st_dev;         /* (drive number, rtfs) */
00097     INT16           st_ino;         /* inode number (0) */
00098     INT16           st_nlink;       /* (always 1) */
00099     INT16           st_rdev;        /* (drive number, rtfs) */
00100     UINT16          fattribute;     /* File attributes - DOS attributes (non standard but useful) */
00101     UINT16          padding;
00102 };
00103

00105 typedef enum {
00106     // Zero is a reserved value
00107     FsMmcSdDev = FS_MMCSD_DEV,
00108     FsNandDev = FS_FTL_DEVICE1,
00109     FsFatFfsDev = FS_FFS_DEVICE
00110     // Insert new device types here
00111 } FsDeviceType;

00128 /* Structure for user to do recursive search for files in a selected drive */
00129 struct FatFindData {
00130     CHAR    fname[10];      /* Null terminated file and extension */
00131     CHAR    fext[4];
00132     UINT16  fattribute;     /* File attributes */
00133     UINT16  ftime;          /* Time & Date last modified. See date */
00134     UINT16  fdate;          /* and time handlers for getting info */
00135     UINT32  fsize;          /* File size */
00136     INT16   driveno;
00137     CHAR    longFileName[FS_MAXPATH];
00138     CHAR    pname[10];      /* Pattern. */
00139     CHAR    pext[4];
00140     CHAR    path[FS_MAXPATH];
00141     CHAR    plongFileName[FS_MAXPATH];
00142     void    *pobj;
00143     void    *pmom;
00144 };

00148     FatFileAttrHidden       = AHIDDEN,
